alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of South Central Arizona and Southeast Arizona, including the following counties, in South Central Arizona, Pima. In Southeast Arizona, Cochise and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in several locations. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sierra Vista, Benson, Willcox, Whetstone, Huachuca City, St. David, Tombstone, Sonoita, Dragoon, Elgin, Kartchner Caverns State Park, Pearce-Sunsites, Fort Huachuca, Parker Canyon Lake, Mescal, Cochise, Fairbank, Texas Canyon, Charleston and Ramsey Canyon Preserve. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
